Prefers loose sandy soil; ideal for rainfed areas.
Leguminous crop; fixes atmospheric nitrogen.
Requires moderate rainfall and good drainage.
Best in cool climates with good irrigation.
Needs standing water during growing season.
Requires heavy irrigation and rich organic matter; ideal for tropical regions.
Prefers cool climate; avoid excess moisture during bulb formation.
Needs full sunlight and moderate rainfall; suitable for dryland farming.

Heavy feeder; frequent irrigation and organic mulch recommended.
Requires moderate rainfall and staking; avoid waterlogging.
Grows best in warm climates; regular irrigation improves yield.
Requires good drainage; avoid high humidity during flowering.
Deep-rooted crop; needs dry spell for flowering and humid period for fruiting.
Tolerant to varying soil types; pruning improves fruit quality.
Apply basal dose before sowing and top dress urea at tillering stage.
Requires less fertilizer; apply nitrogen in two equal splits.
